title: 8 Simple Ways to Fix Alexa Not Responding to Voice Commands

steps.title: Unplug the device for about 20 minutes, then plug it back in.
steps.content: Unplug the device for about 20 minutes, then plug it back in. This allows Alexa to restart fully. When it powers on again, try using voice commands again.

steps.title: Make sure you're using the correct cables.
steps.content: Make sure you're using the correct cables. If you don't have the original power adapter that came with your device, make sure you have a replacement certified by Amazon. Faulty adapters can cause hardware issues. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Try using a different Wake Word.
steps.content: Try using a different Wake Word. This is the word that wakes your Alexa . Someone may have changed this unknowingly. You can change the Wake Word in the mobile app.

steps.title: Verify Alexa is connected to your Wi-Fi.
steps.content: Verify Alexa is connected to your Wi-Fi. While Alexa can still be used as a Bluetooth device without Wi-Fi, it will be extremely limited. If it's not responding, it may not have the resources for an answer. You may need to troubleshoot your internet .

steps.title: Check if your device is muted.
steps.content: Check if your device is muted. When Alexa is muted, the light will be red. Some models may have a physical button; this looks like a speaker icon.

steps.title: Try asking your question differently.
steps.content: Try asking your question differently. Sometimes, questions are too broad or complicated for the AI to answer.

steps.title: Press the Action button.
steps.content: Press the Action button. On Alexa devices without a screen, this is a physical button on your device. Pressing it should prompt Alexa to respond. Make sure to test the volume buttons too; it may have been lowered by mistake.

steps.title: Put your Alexa device away from obstructions.
steps.content: Put your Alexa device away from obstructions. Find a place for your Alexa device that doesn't have a lot of background noise or other competing devices.
